intro: Caperonia heteropetala var. brevifolia, commonly known as the short-leaved caperonia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and small, elliptical leaves that are typically hairy on the underside. The flowers are usually white or pale pink, with five petals and a prominent yellow stamen. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions of South America. This variant is distinguished by its shorter leaves compared to the typical form of Caperonia heteropetala.
